snippet: The film isn’t showing until Dec. 17 and plenty of tickets are left, but to more than 100 people in Hollywood, the vigil is part of the experience.
abstract: Number of fans queue up for first showing of Star Wars: The Force Awakens at Hollywood’s historic Chinese Theater almost two weeks before opening day; say they prefer to camp out with like-minded others in front of theater where first Star Wars film opened in 1977, rather than buying reserved tickets online.
lead_paragraph: The film isn’t showing until Dec. 17 and plenty of tickets are left, but to more than 100 people in Hollywood, the vigil is part of the experience.

headline.main: ‘Star Wars: The Force Awakens’ Fans Are Already Lining Up
headline.print_headline: ‘Star Wars’ Fans Say the Line Starts Here

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: TCL Chinese Theater Imax (Los Angeles, Calif)
